description: Borrowed from Hindi डकैत (ḍakait)/Urdu ڈکیت‎ (ḍakait), from डाका (ḍākā, “gang-robbery”)/Urdu ڈاکا‎ (ḍākā).

entries.meaning: (chiefly India, Myanmar, Pakistan) A bandit or armed robber, especially former parts of British India.
examples: […]  she had harangued us on the subject of fever and cholera and bad water, had warned us solemnly against dacoits, and now she was hinting at ghosts.

verbs.description: dacoit (third-person singular simple present dacoits, present participle dacoiting, simple past and past participle dacoited)
